lines.text: The boat doesn't stop at Santa Maria this trip.
Why not?
They have no bananas.
They have no bananas?
Yes, they have no bananas.
Say, isn't that girl the one he used to be in love with?
Bonnie, when it rains, every third drop falls on one of them.
He was quoting Shakespeare, "Henry the 4th" I think, he said. "We owe God a death, if we pay it today, then we don't owe it tomorrow".
He's no fool.
Got a match?
Say, don't you ever have any?
No - don't believe in laying in a supply of anything.
[she hands him a match]
Thanks.
Matches, marbles, money or women, huh?
That's right.
No looking ahead; no tomorrows; just today.
That's right.
Someday I'll get a straight answer from you, and I won't know what to do with it.
They must love it. Flying, I mean.
Why do you think they come down to this kind of a place?
It's like being in love with a buzz saw.
Not much future in it.
What is there about it that gets them?
I'm not a flier myself. Hey, you'd better ask the Kid. Miss Lee. Mr. Dabb.
How'd you do?
She wants to know why you like flying.
I've been in it 22 years, Miss Lee. I couldn't give you an answer that would make any sense. What's so funny about that?
That's what my dad used to say.
Flier?
No, trapeze. High stuff. He wouldn't use a net.
Not much future in that, either.
Yes. We found that out.
What was she like, anyway?
Who?
That girl that made you act the way you do.
A whole lot like you. Just as nice, almost as smart.
Chorus girl?
Only by temperament.

[the other fliers won't drink with McPherson]
Do you mind, Elena? We're going to move. Coming Geoff?
No, this is good enough for me.
Not so particular, huh?
I don't think even *you* can spoil good liquor.
You got the job.
Maybe I ought you pat you on the back.
You don't have to. Just do what I tell you to do.
You mean anything that's a little too tough for somebody else, huh?
Yeah, that's about it. Look, fella, I'm knee-deep in friends around here, but you're one guy I can send out in any kind of weather on any kind of job, and only worry about the ship getting back.
I see.
On those terms, you still want the job?
I don't know any other way I'd want it.
You love him, don't you, Kid?
Yes, I guess I do.

Why can't I love him the way you do? Why couldn't I sneer when he tries to kill himself, feel proud when he doesn't? Why couldn't I be there to meet him when he gets back? Why couldn't I... What do you do when he doesn't come back when you expect him to?
I go nuts.
Gee whiz, you're a great help.
I'm hard to get, Geoff. All you have to do is ask me.
The only thing I can tell you about him, he's a good guy for gals to stay away from.
Say, things happen awful fast around here.
Calling Baranca! Calling Baranca!
Tell you what, I'll toss a coin, heads you stay, tails you go.
I know, I know, you'd never ask any woman to do anything.

[watching Geoff try to land a damaged plane]
He's gonna try to land!
He can't make it.
Not with that tail all smashed up. Not in a million years.
Get set for the crash, Mike!
Why doesn't he jump?
Why? Why should he? He's made of rubber, he is. He wants to hit the ground to see how high he can bounce!
How about a light?

[giving him matches]
Isn't it about time you started carrying some of those?
Say, who's running this airline?
I am.
Sometimes, you forget that.
Did you ever hear of the word "trust"?
I did once, but I forgot it.
So you're still carrying a torch for her?
Gotta light?

[Judy's drunk and stumbles]
Quick, close the door. Judy's lost her equilibrium.
How can you eat that?
What?
Eat that steak.
Well, what's the matter with it?

[referring to Joe]
It was his!
Well, what do you want me to do, have it stuffed?
Wait a minute, you little fool, why don't you use your ...
[sees that she's crying]
Oh, come on. Stop it.
I don't know how you can act like this when that poor kid, he's ...

[coldly]
Yeah, I know, he's dead.
Yes, he's dead!
That's right. And he's been dead about 20 minutes, and all the weeping and wailing in the world won't make him any deader 20 years from now. If you feel like bawling, how do you think we feel?
Oh, I'm sorry...
Oh, come on. Go outside and walk around - and stay there until you put all that together!
What's all this?
What?
All this cooking!
Oh, that's coffee.
Look at this mess...
Don't touch it, it's hot! You'll burn yourself.
[he touches it]
Oh, I told you!
Ah, ah. Go away, go away!
Ooh, that is a burn. Here, I'll put some butter on it.
I don't want any butter on it.
Oh, but it'll make you feel better!
I told you, I don't want any butter on it!
My grandmother always used butter...
I don't care what your grandmother did!
[referring to the coffee]
It's still boiling! What's all this about?
Oh, I just thought I'd like to have a nice cup of coffee. It's so cold and rainy outside and nice and cozy in here.
Oh...
Wouldn't you like to have one, too?
No, I wouldn't, and get out of here and stop making a mess and stay out of my room, and take this with you...
[reaches for kettle]
Oh, don't ...
[picks up kettle, whistles in surprise]

[laughs]
I thought you never did that.
Did what?
Got burned twice in the same place.

[Joe has just died and Bonnie is feeling guilty about his death]
Mr. Carter? Mr. Carter? Do you really think... I mean... Do you really think it was my fault, what happened out there?

Sure it was your fault. You were gonna have dinner with him, the Dutchman hired him, I sent him up on schedule, the fog came in, a tree got in the way. All your fault. Forget it, unless you want the honor.
You'd better be good!
I won't be as corny as you.
You're a queer duck, Bonnie.
Ah, so are you.
